channel.title: My old puter
channel.description: I just scrapped up an old computer with some miscellaneous parts I had. She's got a 4GB HD, the pcu is around 2ghz, and 704MB of RAM. I slapped 98 on her and she runs like a beast. I'm wondering if anyone has any ideas of what I could do with her? Maybe experiment with some different operating systems (atm I'm biased towards windows) or make it into a small server of some sort. Iono, post some ideas up of what I should do with her.

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @jcs_double jcs_double
item.description:
@jcs_double wrote:

try turing it into a server of some sort and just lan it to you computer and share the internet with it

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

try xubuntu, it a lightweight distro of ubuntu

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @Aukake Aukake
item.description:
@Aukake wrote:

So the general consent is some distro of linux…

I guess I want something with some networking capabilities. I know nothing of networking and the likes so I figure this will be a good opportunity for me to try to make some sort of server. Right now, because of my hard drive limitations I’m leaning towards something smaller (I’m really interested in DSL.) I might upgrade in the future but right now my cash flow is tied up in other things.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

And DSL isn’t easy to use? I’ve never used ubuntu personally because it’s huge.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @papetowe papetowe
item.description:
@papetowe wrote:

DSL is ok. Just try ubuntu firsvet (very easy) its what i started out with.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

Why is everybody saying DSL. Sure, it’s small, but there are a number of distros you can fit on 4gb hd. Try Debian if you really want to learn. Ubuntu if you’re a pussy and just want stuff to work.
BTW, that computer’s not that old. Give it a new harddrive and it will be pretty sweet. 2ghz, that’s slow now? Even though I’m running on dual 2.8 it just doesn’t seem like that is really that old of a computer.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

if its a crossover cable (hold both ends together and look at them in the same direction, if the colours of the wires are in the same order, it is just a normal network cable) you can just plug each end into each computer and then run the network wizard. if its a nomal network cable, just go out and buy a crossover cable

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

Im not sure about the network,

But yes you said you r biased about wihndows try DSL, works great

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @Aukake Aukake
item.description:
@Aukake wrote:

I’d think it’d be kind of cool to set up a network between the computer I’m on now and the one I’m talking to you about. Anyway I could do that with a length of rj45? (They’ve both got ethernet connections)

I’ve already tried but failed miserably and I hate researching this type of stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

Load Damn Small Linux onto it and it’ll run beautifully, load TinyXP onto it(I’ve got a 133 Mhz lappy with 96 megs of ram and 1.5 gig hd, and it runs without any lagging EVER), or load Windows 95 onto it. Or send it to me.

Read full topic

item.title: My old puter
item.dc:creator: @The_Prince_of_Random The Prince of Randomness
item.description:
@The_Prince_of_Random wrote:

Hmm, i think you should run DSL on it… or some other linux?

DSL is here: http://damnsmalllinux.org

Read full topic
